headline: It sure looks like OpenAI trained Sora on game content — and legal experts say that could be a problem
summary: OpenAI has never revealed exactly which data it used to train Sora, its video-generating AI. But from the looks of it, at least some of the data might've come from Twitch streams and walkthroughs of games. Sora launched on Monday, and I've been playing around with it for a bit (to the extent the capacity issues will allow). headline: Mag 7 will 'power through' markets in 2025: Strategist
summary: Roundhill Investments CEO David Mazza joins Market Domination Overtime to discuss why the Magnificent Seven stocks — Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — are positioned to outperform in markets in 2025. "People don't want to be on the wrong side of what has been, for two years, an incredibly impressive trade," he tells Yahoo Finance. Investors are returning to the Magnificent 7 names because these stocks provide both offensive and defensive strategies in the current market landscape. "These companies as a whole... really have impressive operating leverage," Mazza notes. With uncertainty surrounding potential tariffs and inflation in the upcoming year, investors are seeking companies that can "power through" economic challenges, which increasingly points them toward the Magnificent Seven. Despite this focus, Mazza adds: "I think there is a general sentiment that the economy is okay, and we have so much positive investor sentiment right now, and that to me is what's really pushing the market higher." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Microsoft Stock Posts Highest Close In Nearly 5 Months, Hits Early Entry; Why It's A Buy Again
summary: Enterprise software juggernaut Microsoft, like most tech stocks, has gotten off to a nice start in the final month of 2024.  On Friday, while the gain was mild, Microsoft stock still advanced for a sixth straight session.  Back in November, Microsoft stock handled reports of a potential government investigation into the company's cloud computing business with strength.

Back in November, Microsoft stock handled reports of a potential government investigation into the company's cloud computing business with strength.

headline: Microsoft expects $800 million impairment charge in Q2 2025 over General Motors' Cruise exit
summary: General Motors said on Tuesday it is ending robotaxi development, in which it invested more than $10 billion since 2016, citing competition in the robotaxi market and the "time and resources" that would be needed to scale the business.  Microsoft acquired a minority stake in Cruise in January 2021 in a combined new equity investment of more than $2 billion, which included institutional investors such as Honda Motor Co.  The Windows maker also said the impairment charge would have a negative impact of about 9 cents on its second-quarter earnings per share.

raw.headline: Microsoft expects $800 million impairment charge in Q2 2025 over General Motors' Cruise exit
raw.summary: General Motors said on Tuesday it is ending robotaxi development, in which it invested more than $10 billion since 2016, citing competition in the robotaxi market and the "time and resources" that would be needed to scale the business.  Microsoft acquired a minority stake in Cruise in January 2021 in a combined new equity investment of more than $2 billion, which included institutional investors such as Honda Motor Co.  The Windows maker also said the impairment charge would have a negative impact of about 9 cents on its second-quarter earnings per share.

headline: Alphabet's Gemini 2.0, UnitedHealth, Stitch Fix: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance special reporter Akiko Fujita breaks down some key headlines in today's Market Minute. Shares of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) hit a 52-week high after the company debuted its latest AI model, Gemini 2.0. The company also has called for the FTC to break up Microsoft's (MSFT) cloud deal with OpenAI. UnitedHealth Group (UNH) shares are under pressure, following news from the Wall Street Journal of a bipartisan bill to force prescription drug middlemen to divest from pharmacies they own. Stitch Fix (SFIX) shares have rallied after exceeding Wall Street's expectations for the company's fiscal first quarter, despite its number of active clients declining 18% year-on-year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Kevin Hall.

headline: Google asks FTC to break up Microsoft's cloud deal with OpenAI, the Information says
summary: The conversation happened after the U.S. Federal Trade Commission asked Google about Microsoft's business practices as part of a broader investigation, the report said, citing a person directly involved in the discussion.  Tech companies that compete with Microsoft in renting out cloud servers, such as Google and Amazon, also want to host OpenAI's models so that their cloud customers don't need to access Microsoft servers to get access to the startup's technology, the report said.

raw.headline: Google asks FTC to break up Microsoft's cloud deal with OpenAI, the Information says
raw.summary: The conversation happened after the U.S. Federal Trade Commission asked Google about Microsoft's business practices as part of a broader investigation, the report said, citing a person directly involved in the discussion.  Tech companies that compete with Microsoft in renting out cloud servers, such as Google and Amazon, also want to host OpenAI's models so that their cloud customers don't need to access Microsoft servers to get access to the startup's technology, the report said.

headline: General Motors Scraps Cruise Robotaxi Program
summary: General Motors  has scrapped its Cruise robotaxi program after nearly a decade and $10 billion in development, citing the time and costs needed to scale the business and rising competition.  GM on Tuesday said it plans to realign its autonomous driving strategy and give priority to development of advanced driver assistance systems, which take over steering and other functions in certain situations and are common on new vehicles today.  The automaker said it would continue to develop fully autonomous technology for personal vehicles, and build on the progress of its Super Cruise system, a hands-off, eyes-on driving feature that the company introduced several years ago.

raw.headline: General Motors Scraps Cruise Robotaxi Program
raw.summary: General Motors  has scrapped its Cruise robotaxi program after nearly a decade and $10 billion in development, citing the time and costs needed to scale the business and rising competition.  GM on Tuesday said it plans to realign its autonomous driving strategy and give priority to development of advanced driver assistance systems, which take over steering and other functions in certain situations and are common on new vehicles today.  The automaker said it would continue to develop fully autonomous technology for personal vehicles, and build on the progress of its Super Cruise system, a hands-off, eyes-on driving feature that the company introduced several years ago.
